lev1.para: Code 04145 is a single piston type sliding caliper brake used only on front wheels. Codes 04144, 04146, 04237 and 04238 hydraulic disc brakes are dual piston sliding caliper brakes used on front and rear wheels ( Figure 1and Figure 2).

figure.caption: Figure 1. Front Caliper Disc Brake Assembly (Dual Piston)
Figure 2. Rear Caliper Disc Brake Assembly (Dual Piston)

lev1.para: The caliper attaches to and slides within an anchor plate (bracket), hence the term "sliding or floating" calipers. The anchor plate is mounted to the steering knuckle on the front axle and on the axle flange on the rear axle.

The basic components of the caliper disc brake are the caliper, rotor and pads. Pads are mounted on each side of the rotor and grip the rotor when hydraulic pressure is applied by the master cylinder forcing out the piston from the caliper, in turn forcing the brake pads against the rotor.

note.para: It is not uncommon for disc brakes to have a slight drag.

lev1.para: All chassis equipped with disc brakes have a split hydraulic brake system ( Figure 3).

The split hydraulic brake system has a dual piston chamber brake master cylinder. The system also has a brake warning light switch valve that senses a hydraulic pressure loss in either of the split systems should a failure occur. Complete detailed information on this system can be found in GROUP 04 -BRAKES HYDRAULIC in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
A Hydro Max Booster system provides brake power assist. Complete details covering this system can be found in GROUP 04 - BRAKES HYDRAULIC in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
